column4: this is .. frustrating, why couldn't .deb contain a cpio or tar.bz2 directly, wtf is with this "ar" format :-/
great, where does it live? googling for unar on 8kb/sec mobile inet sucks big time
Why are you trying to manually extract a .deb?
need the swiss wordlist from the intrepid repo, not on ubuntu right now, limited inet connectivity & doing an audit
ok, dpkg-deb -x is what you want to use to just extract a .deb to peek inside its files
oh.... or does "not on ubuntu" mean "not on any dpkg-based distro at all" ?
maxb:: yup, sadly, seeing if I can install dpkg easier than finding "ar" atm
any linux system should include ar. It's a fairly ancient part of the unix tradition :-)
ar is part of binutils on Linux, if that helps you find it
